alert.note: Alert for Crosby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 10:48PM CDT until May 11 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Eastern Lubbock County and Western Crosby County. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen and street flooding is likely. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in slow drainage of area roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Slaton, Crosbyton, Ralls, Lorenzo, Caprock and Cone. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
